scene_id.description: Unique identifier for the scene or interaction use only Chapter as identifier.

setting.description: The location and time period where the interaction takes place.

characters.description: List of characters involved in the interaction.

role.description: The character's role or function in the scene.

description.description: Brief description of the character's personality or appearance.

interaction_summary.description: A brief summary of the interaction between the characters.

emotional_tone.description: Overall emotional tone of the interaction (e.g., tense, humorous, romantic).

power_dynamics.description: Analysis of the power dynamics between the characters in the scene.

plot_development.description: How this interaction contributes to the overall plot development.

relationship_development.description: How this interaction impacts the development of relationships between characters.

narrative_perspective.description: The point of view from which the interaction is narrated (e.g., first-person, third-person).

authorial_style.description: Description of the author's writing style in this interaction (e.g., use of irony, satire).

historical_context.description: Relevant historical or social context for understanding the interaction.

reader_response.description: Potential reader reactions or interpretations of the interaction.

foreshadowing.description: Instances of foreshadowing present in the interaction.

irony.description: Instances of irony (situational, dramatic, verbal) present in the interaction.

moral_implications.description: Moral implications or ethical dilemmas raised by the interaction.

character_name_a.description: The name of the first character in the interaction.

character_name_b.description: The name of the second character in the interaction.

interaction_type.description: The nature of the interaction (e.g., 'Conversation', 'Argument', 'Shared Glance', 'First Meeting', 'Proposal').

sentiment_A_to_B.description: The primary sentiment of character_name_a towards character_name_b in this specific interaction (e.g., 'Disdain', 'Admiration', 'Curiosity', 'Anger').

sentiment_B_to_A.description: The primary sentiment of character_name_b towards character_name_a in this specific interaction.

summary.description: A very brief summary of this specific pairwise interaction.

pairwise_relationships.description: A list of specific one-on-one interactions that occurred within this scene. Focus on direct exchanges or significant moments between two characters.
